entry.tran: 无事实根据的；没有理由的
entry.def: If you describe a rumour, belief, or feeling as unfounded, you mean that it is wrong and is not based on facts or evidence.

example.ex: There were unfounded rumours of alcohol abuse...
example.tran: 一些毫无根据的酗酒谣言在流传。
这些指控完全没有事实根据。

means.word_mean: 1. without a basis in reason or fact;

auth_sentence.content: Western scepticism over Japanese apologies is not entirely unfounded.
auth_sentence.res_content: Western scepticism over Japanese apologies is not entirely unfounded.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Western scepticism over Japanese apologies is not entirely unfounded.

auth_sentence.content: Safety fears turned out to be largely unfounded.
auth_sentence.res_content: Safety fears turned out to be largely unfounded.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Safety fears turned out to be largely unfounded.

auth_sentence.content: So to call this a political arrest is really unfounded.
auth_sentence.res_content: So to call this a political arrest is really unfounded.

means.word_mean: 无事实根据的;无基础的

sentences.en: We hold that their proposal is unfounded.
